mdma.lammps.wrapper module¶

Module defining a wrapper on top of the python interface to LAMMPS in order to streamline the process of creating and running molecular dynamics simulations.

class mdma.lammps.wrapper.Ensemble¶

Bases: object

Numerical identifiers for the possible ensembles.

This is intended as a simple enumeration implementation.

NPT = 2¶
NVT = 1¶
class mdma.lammps.wrapper.LammpsExecutable(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: lammps.PyLammps

Executable for LAMMPS simulations.

This is the main entry point for starting new simulations or resuming old ones.

box¶

The simulation box.

Returns:a 2 by d array giving the boundaries in each dimension.
Return type:box (numpy.ndarray)
box_dimensions¶

The simulation box’s dimensions.

Returns:a d-dimensional array giving the width of each dimension.
Return type:box (numpy.ndarray)
composition¶

Get composition of system, i.e. the number of atoms of each species as a fraction of the total number of particles.

Returns:An m dimensional array where m in the total number of unique species, giving the compositional make-up of each species. The array is ordered by species number.
Return type:composition (numpy.ndarray)
coordinates¶

Atom coordinates.

Returns:n by d array giving coordinates of the atoms.
Return type:x (numpy.ndarray)
density¶

The number density.

Returns:atoms per unit volume.
Return type:density (scalar)
initial_box(system, initial_snapshot, seed_density=0.001)¶

Determine size of initial box for system.

This is an internal helper function for initialise_system, so the typical end user should not need to touch this.

There are three (valid) scenarios:

  1. An initial snapshot is specified but not a density: the snapshots box is returned.
  2. An initial snapshot is specified as well as a density: the snapshots box is rescaled to match the target density and returned.
  3. A snapshot is not specified but a density is: a cubic box of the target density is returned.
Parameters:
  • system (mdma.lammps.PotentialBase) – The parameters of the model system to simulate, as well as simulation parameters e.g. the density which will be used to set the box dimensions if specified.
  • initial_snapshot (mdma.Snapshot or None) – The starting configuration for the simulation. If None then that means one should be generated from a random seed, and a cubic box will be chosen for this purpose.
Returns:

The box boundaries in each dimension.
Return type:

initial_box (numpy.ndarray)
initialise_system(system, initial_snapshot=None)¶

Initialise a new LAMMPS simulation from parameters.

Parameters:
  • system (mdma.lammps.PotentialBase) – The parameters of the model system to simulate, as well as simulation parameters e.g. the thermostat or neighbour detection.
  • initial_snapshot (mdma.Snapshot or None) – The starting configuration for the simulation. If None then one will be generated from a random seed.
Raises:

  • RuntimeError – When attempting to initialise an existing simulation.

  • ValueError – When system contains a partial description of a simulation. This happens when:

    • Neither a density, pressure or an initial configuration is given so a starting configuration cannot be generated.
    • Pressure is specified but not an initial configuration.
    • An unknown ensemble is specified (this should never happen as the ensemble is chosen from parsing the incoming data).
natoms¶

Total number of atoms.

Returns:The number of atoms.
Return type:natoms (int)
read_script(path)¶

Implementation detail for resume: reads e.g. history files.

Parameters:path (str) – Location of the file to read.
Returns:List of the lines (strings) in the file.
Return type:lines (list)
restore_fixes(history)¶

Implementation detail when resuming from the disk: restores thermostat fixes from the command history.

Parameters:history (list) – Command history from the trajectory. Active fixes are determined and applied from this.
resume(path)¶

Resume a saved trajectory from the disk.

Parameters:path (str) – Location of the trajectory to load.
Raises:RuntimeError – If attempting to load a trajectory over an existing simulation; this should only be called on new LammpsExecutable objects to prevent loss of data.
save(path, overwrite=True)¶

Save the simulation to the disk.

If the simulation is a continuation of a previous trajectory, then this will only append to existing data.

Parameters:
  • path (str) – Path to write to.
  • overwrite (bool) – Whether it is okay to overwrite an existing trajectory. Should be set to false the first time writing a new trajectory to disk to avoid deleting old data.
snapshot¶

Current snapshot of simulation state.

Returns:The current state.
Return type:snapshot (mdma.atom.AtomSnapshot)
species¶

Species of each atom.

Returns:n-dimensional array giving species of the atoms.
Return type:x (numpy.ndarray)
thermodynamics¶

Return table of summary thermodynamic data from trajectory’s history.

Returns:A pandas.DataFrame object summarising the thermodynamics.
volume¶

Total system volume.

Returns:total system volume.
Return type:volume (scalar)
mdma.lammps.wrapper.random_seed()¶

Generate a random seed for use by LAMMPS.
